intro: Sarcostemma brunonianum, commonly known as the climbing milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the warm seasons. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Sarcostemma brunonianum is often found growing on trees or shrubs, using its tendrils to climb and spread in shaded environments.
